title: The Hundred
name: A dynamic warm-up exercise that engages the core and boosts circulation.
explanation: Lie on your back with legs bent in a tabletop position (or extended if more advanced).
Curl the head and shoulder tips off the floor.
Pump your arms rhythmically up and down.
breathing_technique: Inhale deeply through your nose.
Exhale forcefully through your mouth.
Coordinate breath with arm pumps.

beginner: Keep your head down and feet on the floor.
Pump your arms gently without lifting the head.
intermediate: Lift your head and shoulders off the mat.
Extend legs to a tabletop position.
advanced: Pump arms vigorously while maintaining the lifted position.

title: The Roll-up
name: Strengthens the abdominal muscles and improves spinal flexibility.
explanation: Lie on your back with legs extended.
Reach arms overhead.
Roll up sequentially,reaching for your toes.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you prepare to roll up.
Exhale as you lift and reach forward.

beginner: Keep your head down and feet on the floor.
Pump your arms gently without lifting the head.
intermediate: Keep legs extended.
Roll up smoothly without using hands.

title: The Roll over
name: Enhances spinal articulation and stretches the hamstrings.
explanation: Lie on your back on a mat with your arms along your sides, palms down.
Keep your neck long, shoulders relaxed, and chest open.
Inhale and extend your legs straight up toward the ceiling at a 90-degree angle, keeping them together.
Toes should be pointed..
breathing_technique: Inhale as you cross the midline (legs up and over).
Exhale as you complete the circle (lower your legs back to the 90-degree position).

beginner: Use your hands to assist in rolling up.
intermediate: Keep legs extended.
Roll up smoothly without using hands.

title: The Single Leg Circles
name: Works the hip flexors and improves hip mobility.
explanation: Lie on your back with one leg extended up.
Circle the extended leg.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you cross the midline.
Exhale as you complete the circle.

intermediate: Keep both legs extended.
Circle the working leg with control.

title: The Rolling Like a Ball
name: A fun exercise that massages the spine and challenges balance.
explanation: Sit on your mat, knees hugged to chest.
Balance on your sit bones.
Roll backward and return to balance.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you roll back.
Exhale as you return to balance.

intermediate: Balance on your sit bones without holding ankles.
Roll back and return to balance.
advanced: Add a full roll to a standing position.

title: The Single Leg Stretch
name: Focuses on core stability and leg coordination.
explanation: Lie on your back, knees bent.
Alternate extending one leg at a time.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you switch legs.
Exhale as you draw the knee in.

intermediate: Lift the head and shoulders.
Alternate legs with control.

title: The Double Leg Stretch
name: Strengthens the core and promotes flexibility.
explanation: Lie on your back, knees hugged to chest.
Extend arms and legs simultaneously.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you extend.
Exhale as you draw back in.

intermediate: Extend both legs.
Lift the head and shoulders.

title: Spire Stretch Forward
name: Stretches the spine and hamstrings.
explanation: Sit tall with legs extended.
Reach forward, lengthening the spine.
breathing_technique: Inhale to prepare.
Exhale as you reach forward.

beginner: Reach forward as far as comfortable.
intermediate: Keep legs extended.
Reach forward with a flat back.
advanced: Reach forward, aiming to touch your toes.

title: Open Leg Rocker
name: A balance challenge that targets the abdominals.
explanation: Sit balanced on your sit bones, legs extended.
Rock backward and return to balance.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you rock back.
Exhale as you return to balance.

intermediate: Balance on your sit bones without holding ankles.
Rock back and return to balance.
advanced: Add a full roll to a standing position.

title: Saw
name: Enhances spinal rotation and coordination.
explanation: Lie on your back, legs extended up.
Circle legs in a controlled manner.
breathing_technique: Inhale as you cross the midline.
Exhale as you complete the circle.

intermediate: Extend both legs.
Circle the legs with control.
